titleStmt.title: C. T. Foulks to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7979

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Philadelphia June 13th. 1863
Office 7th St. No 115:
To. D. C. Wickliffe Esq
Secretary of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
Honl Sir
Your favor of the 7th inst was duly received.
Please accept our sincere thanks, for your very prompt and courteous, reply to our Application, and also for enclosing Coms before receiving fees &c..
Enclosed please find $5, for Coms issued to me. Also "Oath of Office" Signature and impressn of seal --
My associate Mr. Pfeiffer is now out of the City. When he returns he will enclose Oath, Fees, & impression of seal &c.

I have the honor to be
Very Respectfully
C. T. Foulks
for
Foulks & Pfeiffer

Pennsylvania
Comr of Deeds
Oath
Chas T. Foulks
Filed June 18. 1863
